oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Diurnal variation of milk fatty acids in early-lactation Holstein cows with and without hyperketonemia
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: See, Claira
Bach, Kathryn D.
Barbano, D.M.
McArt, Jessica A.A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fourier-transform mid-infrared (FTIR) analysis
energy deficit
milk fatty acids
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Estimates of milk constituents by Fourier-transform mid-infrared (FTIR) analysis offer a promising tool in identifying dairy cows experiencing excessive energy deficit (EED) in early lactation. Our objectives were to describe the diurnal variation of FTIR estimates of milk fatty acids (FA) and the effect of hyperketonemia on this variation.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2021 Annual Conference Proceedings; 247
